alert.note: Alert for Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 4:42AM PST until January 03 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 3 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Tidal overflow flooding expected. * WHERE...In Washington, South Washington Coast. In Oregon, Central Oregon Coast and North Oregon Coast. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 3 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding, up to one foot above ground level in the central Oregon coast and up to 1.5 feet above ground level in the north Oregon, south Washington coast, during high tides is expected in the low lying areas near bays, sloughs, and the lower reaches of the coastal rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... -Total tide (astronomical tide with storm surge) at Toke Point is forecast to peak near 12.5 feet at 1 PM on Monday. -Total tide at Tongue Point in Astoria is forecast to peak near 12 feet at 1 PM on Monday. -Total tide at Garibaldi is forecast to peak near 11.3 feet at 1 PM on Monday. -Total tide at South Beach is forecast to peak near 11.6 feet at noon on Monday.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory means that tidal overflow flooding is expected. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and property.

area.areaDesc: Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast
